title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 27 April 2017 - XWiki
content:
<woshilapin> has quit  
03:37 <sdumitriu> has quit  
03:58 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:02 <sdumitriu> has quit

07:38 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki

08:04 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki

09:30 <mflorea> has quit  
09:49 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:48 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <evalica> has quit  
12:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:13 <evalica1> has quit  
12:13 <faichelbaum> Hi all. While upgrading (following your wiki page for it), from 9.2 to 9.3.1, I encounter this error :  
12:13 <faichelbaum> Caused by: com.xpn.xwiki.store.migration.DataMigrationException: Migration of database [xwiki] has failed, it could not be safely used! Database is currently in version [90000] while the required version is [93000].  
12:14 <faichelbaum> the xwiki.store.migration is well set  
12:14 <faichelbaum> any idea on how to replay the db upgrade ?  
12:14 <tmortagne> faichelbaum: migration it executed automatically at startup  
12:14 <gdelhumeau> do you have a stacktrace?  
12:15 <tmortagne> are you sure it's 9.3.1 ?  
12:15 <tmortagne> this looks like 9.3 bug that was fixed in 9.3.1  
12:15 <faichelbaum> I just downloaded the latest war  
12:15 <faichelbaum> seems to be related to that :  
12:15 <faichelbaum> java.sql.SQLException: Can't create table `xwiki`.`#sql-acf4\_4f5bb` (errno: 150 "Foreign key constraint is incorrectly formed")  
12:15 <tmortagne> make sure you enabled migration in xwiki.cfg  
12:15 <faichelbaum> it's enabled  
12:15 <tmortagne> ha that one I know  
12:15 <tmortagne> I had the same issue  
12:15 <faichelbaum> xwiki.store.migration=1  
12:16 <tmortagne> my tables were MYISAM instead of INNODB  
12:16 <tmortagne> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationMySQL#HConvertfromMyISAMtoInnoDB  
12:16 <faichelbaum> checking  
12:17 <tmortagne> means your wiki were create when INNODB was not properly forced  
12:17 <tmortagne> s/create/created/  
12:17 <tmortagne> and MySQL won't accept foreign key from INNODB table (the new one) to MYISAM table  
12:18 <faichelbaum> indeed  
12:19 <faichelbaum> thanks  
12:40 <faichelbaum> table engine changed but no change on the muigration  
12:40 <faichelbaum> still the same constraint error\  
12:49 <tmortagne> the conversion fixed the issue for me  
12:49 <tmortagne> did you restarted ?  
12:50 <faichelbaum> yup  
12:50 <faichelbaum> twice to be sure  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikiattachment                                                | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikiattachment\_archive                                        | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikiattachment\_content                                        | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikiattrecyclebin                                             | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikidates                                                     | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikidbversion                                                 | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikidoc                                                       | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikidoubles                                                   | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikifloats                                                    | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikiid                                                        | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikiintegers                                                  | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikilargestrings                                              | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikilinks                                                     | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikilistitems                                                 | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikilists                                                     | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikilock                                                      | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikilongs                                                     | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikiobjects                                                   | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikipreferences                                               | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikiproperties                                                | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikircs                                                       | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikirecyclebin                                                | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikispace                                                     | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikistatsdoc                                                  | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikistatsreferer                                              | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:51 <faichelbaum> | xwikistatsvisit                                                | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
12:52 <faichelbaum> | xwikistrings                                                   | InnoDB             | utf8\_bin          |  
13:00 <faichelbaum> any other idea how to deal with this constraint issue ?  
13:00 <tmortagne> faichelbaum: which mysql connector version and MySQL server version are you using ?  
13:01 <tmortagne> my used case was debian package on Ubuntu 17.04  
13:01 <faichelbaum> mariadb 10.1.22 / mysqlconnector 5.1.41  
13:03 <tmortagne> same mysql connector and MySQL server 5.7.17  
13:03 <tmortagne> now that I think of it it was not exactly the same error in my case  
13:04 <tmortagne> but maybe it's mariadb wording  
13:04 <tmortagne> but what is weird is that the error you got suggest a syntax error in the request  
13:04 <faichelbaum> indeed  
13:05 <tmortagne> while in my case it was complaining that it could not resolve the target table  
13:05 <tmortagne> maybe there really is some syntaxe difference between MySQL and MariaDB on this area but I find it weird  
13:05 <tmortagne> maybe there really is some syntaxe difference between MySQL and MariaDB on this area but I find it weird  
13:05 <faichelbaum> for the complete trace: https://pastebin.com/knrdWf9c  
13:06 <tmortagne> problem is that this request is automatically generated by hibernate so there is not much we can do  
13:06 <faichelbaum> likewise  
13:07 <faichelbaum> testing with a mysql instance we have for debug  
13:07 <tmortagne> the request it trying to execute on MariaDB is "alter table activitystream\_events\_status add index FKBF7104E8CB8C5002 (ases\_eventid), add constraint FKBF7104E8CB8C5002 foreign key (ases\_eventid) references activitystream\_events (ase\_eventid)" it seems  
13:07 <tmortagne> maybe the error message is just missleading  
13:13 <faichelbaum> testing with mysql 5.6.33  
13:17 <faichelbaum> same  
13:17 <faichelbaum> so I guess that's no db server side  
13:17 <faichelbaum> but the error has changed a bit :  
13:17 <faichelbaum> java.sql.SQLException: Cannot add foreign key constraint  
13:18 <faichelbaum> https://pastebin.com/XTNp7hEe  
13:18 <tmortagne> that's the error I got with MySQL and which was fixed by converting table activitystream\_events  
13:18 <tmortagne> note that I don't see activitystream\_events table in the list of tables you pasted  
13:19 \* tmortagne sent a long message: tmortagne\_2017-04-27\_11:19:28.txt - https://matrix.org/\_matrix/media/v1/download/matrix.org/iUKSMXZXgXYLYzhqPSVjcLuo  
13:19 <tmortagne> activitystream\_events table is defined in activitystream.hbm.xml  
13:21 <faichelbaum> let me double check  
13:22 <faichelbaum> | activitystream\_events\_status                       | InnoDB             | latin1\_swedish\_ci |  
13:22 <faichelbaum> | activitystream\_events\_targets                      | InnoDB             | latin1\_swedish\_ci |  
13:22 <faichelbaum> charset issue ?  
13:23 <tmortagne> I doubt it but won't arm to fix the charset  
13:24 <faichelbaum> testing  
13:24 <faichelbaum> but the tables are there and with the proper engine  
13:25 <faichelbaum> seems to do it on the mysql server. will test on the mariadb one  
13:25 <faichelbaum> testing  
13:27 <faichelbaum> it's ok  
13:27 <faichelbaum> so the error is due to both engine + charset  
13:27 <tmortagne> ok good to know  
13:28 <tmortagne> the issue should be only with wikis created a long time ago  
13:29 <faichelbaum> :)  
13:44 <VincentMassol[m]> cjd: I'm now on matrix.xwiki.com but it's a major PITA to ping other devs who are on matrix.org since their handle is of the format "freenode\_tmortagne[m]:matrix.org". Anything we can do? If not then it's a problem and we need everyone on matrix.xwiki.com or matrix.org...  
13:45 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <VincentMassol[m]> thomas also raised another problem  
13:48 <VincentMassol[m]> our instructions on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Chat  recommend going to matrix.org  
13:48 <VincentMassol[m]> so we're going to have the same problem for everyone  
13:48 <VincentMassol[m]> so we need to fix this or we'll need to stay on matrix.org...  
13:49 <VincentMassol[m]> I guess matrix.xwiki.com is not public, is it? does it offer anonymous web access?  
13:49 <tmortagne> why do we need our own server again ?  
13:49 <VincentMassol[m]> AFAIU to have better control on the room settings but that seems a low need to me  
13:50 <VincentMassol[m]> and possibly for better perf but we'venot had too many issues so far  
13:51 <tmortagne> having to maintain our own server does not seems to worth it right now  
13:52 <VincentMassol[m]> btw the PITA is not just when pinging others but also to underzstand who's posting a message  
13:52 <tmortagne> yes  
13:52 <VincentMassol[m]> I have to visually parse much before I understand wh'os talkng  
13:52 <tmortagne> my notification really don't look good when you post :)  
13:52 <tmortagne> no photo and a crappy user id  
13:54 <VincentMassol[m]> and indeed the riot client is not multi user so that's a major pita too if you want to use the same tool and be logged on 2 servers....  
13:55 <vmassol> back on matrix.org!  
13:56 <tmortagne> actually i'm using Riot trough Rambox so multi user is not an issue  
13:57 <vmassol> haha yet another client tool to explore ;)  
13:57 <tmortagne> (using Rambox for several slack acounts, Facebook and google)  
13:57 <vmassol> checking it  
13:57 <tmortagne> this one is open source and works pretty well  
13:57 <vmassol> wow even has skype  
13:57 <vmassol> works well for skype?  
13:57 <tmortagne> don't use that  
13:58 <tmortagne> not Rambox fault but Skype online is crap right now  
13:58 <vmassol> you don't use that or you're advising me not to use it?  
13:59 <tmortagne> if you are on Linux then it's fine since new Linux client is pretty much the same thing as Rambox+Skype but Windows/Mac client are way better that Skype Online  
13:59 <tmortagne> if you are on Linux then it's fine since new Linux client is pretty much the same thing as Rambox+Skype but Windows/Mac client are way better that Skype Online  
14:00 <tmortagne> but Skype is a special case, for pure web chats it's great  
14:01 <tmortagne> and the list of supported chats is very impressive  
14:01 <vmassol> ah rambox is using web in its native app... not nice  
14:01 <tmortagne> not sure what you means  
14:02 <tmortagne> the point of rambox is to provide a destop version for all web chats  
14:02 <vmassol> I don't use web chats  
14:03 <tmortagne> Riot is a webchat  
14:04 <tmortagne> what Riot call a desktop client is nothing more that a windows with the wbechat in it, same for slack and others new chat clients  
14:04 <VincentMassol[m]> has left #xwiki  
14:04 <tmortagne> there is no difference between riot client and rambox except that you have tabs with other chats  
14:05 <vmassol> yes ok  
14:07 <floflobel> Hi, is it possible to find the parent of a page just before "WebHome". This would be for a condition on that parent page. I saw the function "$doc.parent" but it only takes the parent of the page and not the largest parent.  
14:07 <tmortagne> haha you even have ICQ support in Rambox, I toughthat was dead  
14:07 <tmortagne> floflobel: $doc.documentReference.parent  
14:08 <tmortagne> $doc.parent is old stuff  
14:12 <floflobel> Ok thanks, is there a documentation with a list of these functions?  
14:13 <vmassol> ok thanks tmortagne , I have now 4 tabs in rambox... let's see how it works. I may have problems with notification overflow, I'll check how to configure this  
14:14 <tmortagne> vmassol: rambox give me desktop style notification, you can mute them if you don't want them form some not that important chat  
14:15 <tmortagne> floflobel: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ScriptingDocumentation/ is nice  
14:17 <floflobel> tmortagne: thank's  
14:17 <tmortagne> this one is what you can find in the version on which xwiki.org runs but you can install it locally too  
14:17 <tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Scripting%20Documentation%20Application  
14:24 <vmassol> cool, thanks for letting me discover rambox tmortagne :) I now have 8 tabs open...  
14:24 <tmortagne> haha  
14:24 <tmortagne> you beat me  
14:24 <vmassol> I didn't want to add too many  
14:24 <vmassol> :)  
14:25 <vmassol> btw it crashed once but restarting it fixed the problem  
14:25 <vmassol> by "crashed" I mean it couldn't connect on one tab (riot)  
14:25 <tmortagne> ok did not had any issue yet  
14:45 <cjd[m]> vmassol (@vmassol:matrix.org): this is the "changeover" which I recommended to you, we can do it at any time and it does not require anybody to change which matrix server they are connected to  
14:46 <vmassol> I don't recall this "changeover" but I don't undestand how it can work if there are 2 servers  
14:47 <vmassol> see the messages above related to the chat page of dev.xwiki.org  
14:47 <vmassol> has left #xwiki  
14:48 <cjd[m]> Why don't you just let me do it and then everybody needs to quit and rejoin the room once and then everybody should see eachothers' avitars, nomatter what server is their homeserver  
14:48 <cjd[m]> This is already done for CryptPad since a long time ago  
14:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:51 <vmassol> who's everybody?  
14:51 <cjd[m]> Everyone who is connected on matrix (except me, amacsween, caubin and pbondoerffer)  
14:51 <cjd[m]> the basic problem is the room is split over two servers at the moment  
14:51 <vmassol> what URL do we put on the http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Chat#HRiot.im section?  
14:52 <cjd[m]> #xwiki:matrix.org  
14:52 <vmassol> ok so there'll still be 2 servers used  
14:53 <cjd[m]> Anyone on any homeserver can access a room  
14:53 <vmassol> and we can continue to use matrix.org  
14:53 <cjd[m]> just right now the room is actually split across 3 homeservers  
14:53 <cjd[m]> \*2  
14:55 <cjd[m]> Basically there are 2 independent rooms which are both bridged to the same IRC channel so you're seeing the echo of people's messages bounced off of IRC, that's why you don't get the avatars  
14:55 <Pbas\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <vmassol> so you're suggesting to delete the #xwiki room on matrix.org and use an #xwiki room on matrix.xwiki.com instead. And for that you need eveyrone on #xwiki @ matrix.org to leave the room? Then any user logged on matrix.org will be able to see the #xwiki room (hosted on matrix.xwiki.com)?  
14:57 <cjd[m]> Right and the reason why the room should be hosted on our homeserver is because we can have operator status which allows (for example) setting the room avatar  
14:58 <cjd[m]> the one on matrix does not give anyone any powers at all  
14:58 <faichelbaum> hi again . seems I have a 404 on require-config.min.js : any idea ? WebJars is well installed in the proper version  
14:58 <cjd[m]> so it will not feel different to anyone because #xwiki:matrix.org will be an alias to our room  
14:58 <cjd[m]> as #cryptpad:matrix.org is an alias to #cryptpad:matrix.xwiki.com  
14:59 <cjd[m]> (and so is #cryptpad:chat.weho.st because the wehost folks like making local aliases)  
14:59 <vmassol> then if there's no downside, let's do it, but don't know how easy it is to get everyone logged out  
14:59 <vmassol> can we see a list of who's connected?  
14:59 <cjd[m]> they can quit at the time they would like  
15:00 <vmassol> I don't understand  
15:00 <vmassol> if they quit they won't see the messages  
15:00 <vmassol> so they cannot do it when they want  
15:00 <cjd[m]> There is no rush for them to leave and rejoin the room  
15:00 <vmassol> I did it btw  
15:00 <vmassol> and it doidn't work  
15:00 <cjd[m]> yeah, you are now on the old channel  
15:00 <cjd[m]> I need to change the alias first :)  
15:00 <vmassol> I've been on matrix.xwiki.com for a week  
15:00 <vmassol> and it's a pain since  
15:01 <vmassol> so it doesn'(t seem like people can do it when they want  
15:01 <slayerjain> has quit  
15:01 <vmassol> AFAIU everyone needs to do it at once  
15:01 <vmassol> no?  
15:03 <cjd[m]> I'm on matrix.xwiki.com and I'm talking to you now...  
15:03 <vmassol> yes and it's bad  
15:03 <vmassol> your handle is crappy  
15:03 <vmassol> which is the problem I raised  
15:03 <vmassol> and the reason I went back to matrix.org  
15:04 <M-cjd> this is me on matrix.org  
15:04 <vmassol> that's better  
15:04 <vmassol> :)  
15:04 <cjd[m]> this is also me on matrix.xwiki.com  
15:05 <cjd[m]> and this is me on matrix.xwiki.com in the split room  
15:05 <vmassol> that's slighty worse  
15:05 <vmassol> your handle: "cjd (@cdelisle:matrix.xwiki.com)"  
15:05 <M-cjd> that's because there are now 2 cjds in the room  
15:05 <tmortagne> well it's not worst  
15:05 <tmortagne> now we see the picture and the user is listed as connected  
15:05 <vmassol> worse than "cjd" thomas  
15:05 <tmortagne> sure  
15:06 <tmortagne> but ut's way better than the previous bridge  
15:06 <vmassol> yes  
15:06 <tmortagne> also completion works  
15:06 <tmortagne> it's good enough for me  
15:07 <vmassol> so what did you do? what do we need to do?  
15:07 <cjd[m]> Seems there is some change now with removing aliases on matrix.org so you might be stuck with the matrix.org channel  
15:07 <cjd[m]> I'm asking  
15:07 <cjd[m]> If that is so, I'll unsplit the room by aliasing this way, the split will be gone but you can never change the avitar or ban anyone  
15:10 <MatrixTraveler[m> has joined #xwiki  
15:10 <M-cjd> has left #xwiki  
15:10 <Pbas\_\_> has quit  
15:12 <faichelbaum> for my issue above (the JS), it was the private key not loaded for the WSS  
15:13 <cjd[m]> I'll see if there is any answer from the matrix folks, if it is possible then we can re-unify the channel with permissions, otherwise if it is not allowed anymore then best we can do is re-unify the channel but with no permissions.  
15:16 <faichelbaum> has quit  
15:18 <M-cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <cjd> gonna try something...  
15:23 <cjd> doesn't work  
15:24 <cjd[m]> No answer from the folks in Matrix HQ so do you want something quick and you don't own the channel or do you want to wait and see if you can get something that is working ?  
15:24 <vmassol> personally I'm fine since I'm back on the matrix.org channel and the majority of the committers are thrre too  
15:24 <M-cjd> ok  
15:24 <vmassol> and I'm using rambox now  
15:25 <vmassol> so I have 2 tabs for Riot  
15:25 <M-cjd> I'll reunify it on that side, but you can never ban anybody  
15:25 <vmassol> apparently we don't have a choice from I understand you said  
15:26 <M-cjd> Alternative is to wait and see if the matrix.org folks can fix it for us  
15:26 <vmassol> as I said I can wait  
15:26 <faichelbaum> has joined #xwiki  
15:26 <vmassol> since I'm good ATM  
15:27 <cjd[m]> ok  
15:27 <cjd[m]> has left #xwiki  
15:28 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
15:29 <pbondoerffer[m]> mflorea: so im looking at XWIKI-10122, and i was wondering how advanced date filters should be. the example in XWIKI-5889 seems to be simple inputs for numbers. or would date ranges be better? how exactly does one filter a date?  
15:31 <vmassol> @freenode\_pbondoerffer[m]:matrix.org: you may want to join matrix.org to have a nice nick handle ;)  
15:31 <cjd[m]> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <cjd[m]> you can /join #xwiki:matrix.org from your xwiki.com account  
15:32 <msmeria> has quit  
15:32 <cjd[m]> you can join any channel from any account  
15:32 <pbondoerffer[m]> hello?  
15:33 <vmassol> nicer :)  
15:33 <pbondoerffer[m]> still using matrix.xwiki.com, just now im using the split channel  
15:33 <pbondoerffer[m]> thanks cjd  
15:33 <vmassol> cool  
15:34 <pbondoerffer[m]> has left #xwiki  
15:34 <gdelhumeau> is my nickname good?  
15:35 <vmassol> es  
15:35 <vmassol> yes  
15:35 <cjd[m]> for them it is, for me its not

15:40 <mflorea> pbondoerffer[m]: there are many ways in which you can filter a date column, but I think we can group them in two categories: range match and exact match.  
15:40 <mflorea> Examples of range match: "pages modified in March this year", "pages modified this week", "page modified today", etc.  
15:40 <mflorea> Examples of exact match: "pages modified in the month of March (any year)", "pages modified in 12 April, any year" etc.  
15:40 <mflorea> now you need to see which use case is more common
